results.title: Alcohol
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Single Concept Drug Films”.
This film shows alcohol as a mood changing substance. It shows the effects of different levels of alcohol consumption, which can lead to coma and death in extreme cases. The film stresses that decisions to use alcohol are best left to the informed individual. Suitable for secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Sedatives
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Single Concept Drug Films”

One of a series of drug films which explains the uses of sedatives and effects on the individual’s personality. Looks at tolerance and physical and psychological dependence.

results.title: Volatile substances
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Single Concept Drug Films”
Informational film on the hazards associated with the abuse of common domestic and industrial chemicals: solvents, aerosol propellants, and anaesthetics. Alludes briefly to the injury which can result from the toxicity of these chemicals - permanent impairment of motor function and acute organ pathology. Directed more towards adult caregivers than the children and adolescents who are more likely to abuse these substances.

results.title: Stimulants
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Single Concept Drug Films”.
One of a series of drug films which is concerned with the effects of stimulants on the nervous system. Shows the results of use of these drugs, and mentions the “speed freak”.

results.title: Marijuana
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Single Concept Drug Films”.
Explains the sources and effects of marihuana on the individual personality, admitting that science has not yet fully researched the drug.

results.title: Alaska: our pioneer heritage...
results.creator_credit: Don Horter and Pan American World Airways
results.brief_description: Discusses industries and the pattern of life in Alaska. The aeroplane has played an important part in the development of this rugged and sparsely-populated country by carrying supplies and goods from city to city and enabling posts in the outback to be established. Fishing is the largest industry, but lumbering and gold mining are important. Eskimos are employed in selling furs and artistic ornaments to tourists. Many visitors come to the country to hunt big game, fish and observe the beauties of snow and ice.

results.title: Aki no ichinichi = A Day in autumn
results.brief_description: Educational film in Japanese language studying Japanese culture. A family outing on an autumn day in a rural area meeting with local farmers and having a picnic.

results.title: Air Conditioned Comfort
results.brief_description: A coarse, insensitive family drives through the National Parks in a luxurious camper, oblivious to the natural beauty around them. The family’s only concern is in looking for real estate, finding the next burger stand and locating the next rest stop. For them the forest is just a place to toss gum wrappers. At the end of the day’s travel, as they are parked in their camper, the family suddenly finds the tables turned in a surprising climax
